If I go to the supermarket to buy milk, and if I pay for the milk, I expect milk - not being sent out with an empty shopping bag after checkout.PayPal is waiting for their response, which they are apparently not providing. Review.Titre: Shady Site Wants Your Phone Numbers
Review.Contenu: After ordering and successful payment I was suddenly asked to give my mobile phone number and then verify that I received a code texted from them. Apparently it's an "important precaution to protect my payment data". They would not let me access the product I just bought until I did it. I don't see how it verifies anything other than that I have a mobile phone. And they already confirmed successful payment so if they were unsure that the card was mine it's a bit late to ask. Can't see any reason for it other than maybe wanting to supplement their income by selling phone numbers to spam companies. When I sent a ticket to customer service asking about it and why it was required, they immediately gave me a refund which is pretty suspicious.

I wish I could do more to ensure businesses like this weren't around.  I find this practice appalling and I don't think anyone should buy products from this company.  You might save money on a product here, but you'll pay for it in other ways.  Keep looking.

Review.Titre: Do Not Trust This French Company

When the preloading for the game starts, I didn't receive my game key as I was suppose to, only to have them just cancel and refund my order when I contacted support and asked where my key was.  I did not make a chargeback. I filed a dispute, then got an email stating "You've made a paypal dispute, you've been refunded of the amount, you're the only responsible of this."  The dispute could have been handled as a normal seller would do, by actually giving the customer the product they had ordered, but you instead decided to become spiteful and cancel my order. It's really bad when a company has to lie to cover their mistakes, but it does let you know what kind of a company you're dealing with and not to deal with them in the future. It also lets other people know how the company acts, and how it's employees are trained to behave.

Just to buy a steam key, I had to sign up for an account, and become a member of their community.  This made me very angry.  That, alone, was terrible customer service.  Although I spent some time searching, I couldn't find any way to delete my account, nor did their emails to me contain this information, which should always be included in such "we've signed you up to our community" type emails.  Agains, terrible customer service.  Frustrating as hell, for no reason at all.   Then, after getting prodded into writing a review, I get another an email from Trustpilot, claiming my review didn't comment on the customer service, when in fact in commented on nothing but (indeed, they're a company selling software written by someone else - nothing but customer service).  I can only conclude they complained to try and get it taken down.  Terrible experience.  I probably should've realised that a retailer that required me to make an account just to buy something was going to be a horrible experience.  I made that mistake, and will never buy from them again.  I'd delete my account if I could, but searching around their website I couldn't find any way to do this, nor did their signup email contain this information.  Don't make the same mistake I did. Unbelievable that in 2014 a company that just sells things over the internet hasn't learnt the lesson of the $300 million button.

Review.Titre: A functional trainwreck with lapses in customer care communication
Review.Contenu: Tried to buy a discounted game key on a time-limited offer; confirmed the purchase with my bank via SMS and was left on a screen telling me that the purchase was being verified by DLGamer, with no hint that there was ANOTHER SMS-based confirmation, this one from DLGamer, incoming at some point in the future.It bounced, the money was locked, I had to argue with my bank to get it back.On the second day, my second try resulted in the successful purchase of a nonfunctioning code, which three attempts to replace failed to get working. Was refunded without being consulted.The money was now locked, again, I had to argue with my bank to get it back, again.I subsequently had no reply for over an entire day, despite inquiries as to the status of the issue. Again, the discount was time-limited. A simple "We're still investigating and will get back to you as soon as possible." would've sufficed.On the third day now, the discount had expired, replaced with a slightly less deep discount. I still had no word back. I attempted to purchase the new deal in a different currency (DLGamer does the whole 1eur=1usd thing), and this time the transaction did NOT require an SMS verification step.Worked fine, got the product registered, and an hour later I finally got word back from DLGamer staff, telling me the issue had been resolved.Thanks... I noticed...TL;DR: Never again, if I can help it.Not 1 star, because I must give kudos to the second Customer Care employee I bumped into. You tried, mate. You damn well tried.Update: I have been billed for both transactions, including the one THAT DID NOT WORK. GG, WP; no RE.1 star it is.

TL;DR:  Would recommend shopping with absolutely anyone else, seriously, pay twice as much if you have to, worst experience I've had with a retailer.  Sure, your purchase will probably go fine but, if it doesn't they will call you a liar to your face and cause you endless stress.Pros: Item purchased 20% cheaper than anywhere else online.Cons: Extra cumbersome steps added for the appearance of 'security' but, don't actually make anything more secure.  There is a required 2 step verification process you find out about after your purchase but, this number does not have to be in any way tied to you.  They couldn't send a verification text to my personal number and wrongfully claimed it was a VoIP number.  I had to borrow a friends phone to finish the purchase.  A phone number check that will accept a random persons phone number does nothing to add to security and adds quite a bit to difficulty if the system is not functioning properly.UPDATE:  Removed a star because they also apparently can't read complaints.  My PayPal account is verified for one, I double-checked right now and, my phone number is with T-Mobile, not 'Google Voice' and is again, not a VoIP line, it's a cell phone.  If their system is claiming otherwise, then their system is at fault.  As an extra bonus, for the friends phone number I borrowed that they claim was in the same 'region', they live in an entirely different state.  If the 'region' is that broad, then using it as a security check is again pointless.  The only thing it adds is extra difficulty to legitimate customers.UPDATE2:  Can't remove any more stars, would recommend anyone else purchasing anything to just pay the extra cost that comes with shopping somewhere legitimate that cares about customer service.  Was called a liar repeatedly via email and received threats and ultimatums asking me to remove my review.  Have just been informed that they are cancelling my order.  Oh, they also reported my review for 'Inappropriate Language' in an attempt to censor it.

Review.Titre: Mobile phone verification after purchase and order cancelled without consent
Review.Contenu: After purchasing my first serial key, I was taken to an order processing page. Here, I learnt that further verification is needed to complete and deliver my purchase.One of these verification steps was to provide my mobile phone number and the verification code sent to it.Doing this after the purchase is probably deliberate on DLGAMER's part. Most people won't want to cancel their order.I don't trust DLGAMER with my personal information, yet I had to surrender my mobile number to receive my order.They did deliver my purchase within minutes of me completing verification. Still, it seems paying with PayPal (who have already verified me) doesn't make a difference. DLGAMER wants your mobile number and I don't know what they will do with it.---"Most of our users appreciate the extra security step"How do you know that?"Do you think we deserve this scoring for our overall services?"Yes.---Update: DLGAMER have now refunded my order and cancelled my serial key. I never asked for this.This is what they said:"We would like to inform you that your order to DLGamer is going to be canceled for one of the following reasons:- Several purchases with a single or multiple credit cards;- Using multiples DLGamer accounts;- Using an Unverified Paypal account;- Using a VPN or Proxy;- incoherent personnal informations provided by customers;- Unanswered or Missing mobile or landline verifiction request;- Cancellation asking on your side;- Refund request due to a mistake."I can confirm that there has been no "cancellation asking" from my side, nor any of the other reasons.They sent a further email:"Following your comment we are sorry that you did not read our general conditions of sale before your purchase you were warned that we could make a verification by sms in particular if you use a means of payment which does not offer any guarantee on the products in download in particular the delivery of your order is made on email different from the owner of the paypal account.We are sorry to have disappointed youWe have therefore refunded your order and your key will be canceledWe invite you to login to your dlgamer account and delete your account."---As a consequence for cancelling and refunding the order without my knowledge or consent, I am downgrading this review to one star.

Review.Titre: They will pre-authorized a charge on your card, and THEN require you to verify your phone number
Review.Contenu: Edit 4: Ladies and Gentlemen, the gloves come off. I've now been called a liar and a fraudster, and they have openly admitted they don't care about my privacy. For those of you not following the show, the summary is that this company will throw you under the bus, back up and run over you again (yes, in this analogy they are the ones pushing and driving apparently). Your experience may go great with this company, but God help you if it doesn't. I thank God they don't have any of my personal info, who knows what they would do with it at this point. Just take some time and read the other negative reviews on this site- it's easy to filter them. You will notice several instances where this company threatens users with order cancellations for posting negative reviews, and a review by Terra in 2016 who said, "They really .. they used my order name instead of my review name when answering. I am .. well, now I'm really worried they have my phone number." Also, make note that there are many 3 and 4-star reviews that state they did not appreciate having their phone number extracted (and probably should have given fewer stars). The bottom line, this company needs to require verification BEFORE order completion (not just show a notice, which failed to appear in my case). This has been a frequent request and complaint since they implemented the system in 2014. I have also updated the title of my review to make it more transparently accurate.Edit 3: Please- keep it coming! Everyone knows the true measure of a company is seen in how they respond to criticism. I have at this point literally read hundreds of 1 and 2-star negative reviews, and dozens more that should have been lower scores but people gave you the benefit of a doubt. The fact that you continue to propagate this "discussion" as an attempt to show I am in the wrong, further serves to illuminate my position. You looked up my IP address on a map, and compared that to the zip I provided- that's a first bad sign as to what is being done with my data. This is why I typically only use VPNs because I can't trust that random websites like yours will actually safeguard my information. For that matter, I read a review where you used another lady's private full name in your response to her review! No, I don't want to provide your site ANY personal information. If I'm providing personal information at all, it is to a PAYMENT PROCESSOR- you require that I fill out my private information into YOUR SITE! Not only can that be illegal, by violating PCI requirements, it is completely disingenuous for you to then turn around and use what little personal information you harvested off me against me. On that note, in response to people's continued questioning about your need for their phone numbers, you've copy/pasted a clause from the EU mandate on online inter-commerce, which clearly states that an IP address alone can be used as validation for an order.  Lastly, thought experiment- if my bank didn't go through with the payment, and I wasn't charged, then why did you need to issue a refund....? Edit 2: So everyone can see how ridiculous this exchange has become- just take a brief look through the rest of the comments and see others' reviews (even ones that are positive). This company will require all of your personal information, including your phone number, *after* you create an account and *after* you complete a purchase with them. You can believe what they say... or believe the thousands of other people who say otherwise. Either way consumer, it's your choice whether or not to purchase from this company.Edit: I do not share personal information with any of the sites I use to purchase game keys from- I have never had a problem with any of them. I understand collecting the minimum information to complete a purchase, but that is not what your site did. You completed a purchase from a consumer and then requested more information than is even generally necessary to verify the information. After begrudgingly sharing any of this information, your site then locked this purchase and asked for even more information. If you need information- please ask for it upfront.  This company charged me and THEN asked me for a bunch of additional information to "verify me" (You already took my money honey, the amount is literally showing as processed on my card). If you're going to ask for information to "verify someone" do it BEFORE you take their money- now I have to deal with this through my bank. Save your time and money and go to another site that's actually verified- stay away from this place.
