Cheap.Don't tell me I need to put in a code sent via SMS after I've already paid. Beforehand yeah ok, after I paid seems sketchy.I put all of my correct details in as well so don't try and use your tired excuse of my credit card details not matching because they did.

Review.Titre: Good deals, but annoying and unprofessional
Review.Contenu: I got a really good deal on a game, but if my friend hadn't assured me it was safe, I would have assumed dlgamer.com was a scam site. It's riddled with bad English and typos, and the process for setting up an account making my first purchase was just ridiculous. I have no desire to come back - I'll just wait for Steam sales.

They require your phone number and don't send keys, but require some sort of link to your gaming account to send licences (in my case, Origin). It would make things "more secure", but this isn't a bank, for something like budget games I don't want more secure -keys-, I want my personal and account details secure -by not giving them to the store- I'm buying from (DLGamer).In the end it worked, but they could be selling my number, or the hook-in to my Origin account could be hacked if they have a breach in the future, who knows.

I recently bought a game from DL Gamer, but couldn’t find the activation code per the instructions.  I emailed their Tech Support and haven’t heard back four days later. I did get get the game to run without a code, but I’m not pleased that Tech Support never responded.

Review.Titre: Why in the world would I need to give a…
Review.Contenu: Why in the world would I need to give a cell phone number to make a purchase? There is absolutely no reason to require personal information for a purchase like this. It's scummy and leaves a terrible taste. On top of that, you wait until after the order has already been made. Accounts being secure is great. But you know what's even better? Not holding my purchase hostage unless I play ball with your data harvesting. I shouldn't need an account just to get a freaking code sent to my email.For shame. I will be actively discouraging anyone from using you in the future. For shame.

Review.Titre: DLGamer required a phonecall to a…
Review.Contenu: DLGamer required a phonecall to a non-voip landline or a text to a non-voip SMS number to make the purchase.  All of my numbers are voip and they never answered my support emails.Somehow their system still released my code so I was able to eventually get the game.  Too much trouble and no support.  Won't buy from them again.

Made a wrong purchase by accident due to lack of info in the description section of the item, asked for a refund, and was met with 1.reluctance to refund, 2.very informal tone and drama after i politely clarified i'd like a refund. 3.   no wonder i made a mistake, because the rep they chose to deal with customer services knows little to no English, which i could barely understand. grammar was nonexistent

a friend downloaded on steam, i downloaded on DLGamer and it took well over an hour just for my purchase to be verified. and another half hour just to get the game going. ridiculous. I will never buy from these guys again. Really DLGamer? Obviously I know the servers to download the game are ran through Bethesda. I mean after the hour wait time, I had to wait another half hour to get my key and start downloading.

Review.Titre: Goods were delivered, but it was an awfully shady experience.
Review.Contenu: The entire experience of purchasing a game from this website felt awful. I was required to provide an address even though I was not receiving physical goods, and required to provide my phone number. The game code I received worked fine, but I am intensely worried that giving this site so much personal information was a mistake.

The amount of required info is kind of insane compared to any other site where you can purchase games from. I thought it was fake, and had to do a lot of digging to see if others had used the site before and if they could confirm it being genuine. Luckily, this is a real site, but customers shouldn't have to second guess like that.

I preordered Battlefront from DLGamer and then noticed that their release date was 11/19. Knowing that the US release date is 11/17, I asked customer service to provide the activation code a little early. For asking, my order was canceled. A polite no would have been fine. They get 2 stars for all the security/fraud prevention measures.

Seriously, who makes you validate your phone number in order to buy a game? Clunky site. Super annoying. Why does it take 10 minutes to get a steam key? It's not delivering a package. I see zero reason to ever use this site unless they have specific games on sale. The interface was clunky, awkward, and confusing.

The order process was rather easy however I ran into one problem.  The game description stated there was no monthly subscription (ESO) needed to play the version purchased.  I was able to download and set the game up easily.  After playing for an hour or so, the game logged me off and sent me to the page which indicates a subscription was necessary to continue playing.  I sent a message regarding the problem through my order form at DL Gamer however there has been no response to resolve the issue.

The game itself runs fine but has some issues and idk whether these issues are because of treyarch or because of where I received my product key from. The purchase process where u enter all ur personal and creditcard info seems extremely impersonal and shiest to me. I don't think I'll buy again from here

Website english translation poor in places.wasnt sure if this was a legitimate website. Took ovrr an hour to sort out my order.kept asking questions for added security and then stating that you already had my details. Amateur website compared to the competition. Will put off some.dont trust it to use again.

DLGamer were not up front about their security procedures. They held my purchase to ransom until I gave them my phone number in order to receive a pin code which then unlocked my game. Otherwise it suggested it would be cancelled and no indication was given if I would get my money back.

I understand there is a limit policy to purchase a single title. So this is not an issue. The issue comes in where I am able to purchase 2 of a title, but have 5 different pending charges with my bank. I could even almost understand if they were for the same amount. However,  this is not the case. Now 6 days later I am still seeing pending charges on my account. Though they assure 3-5 days to resolve "refund" issues. I am extremely disappointed at the lack of customer service, or ability to respond and assist customers in a resolution. I will not use their site again.

Review.Titre: I got the game in the end but ....
Review.Contenu: As first time customer i wanted to pay with my paypal account that i use for purchases all over internet. Payment got accepted, but then they canceled my order and gave me refund without stating reason. Mail with reason that my paypal account isnt vertified and they doesnt accept unvertified paypal accounts arrived like 2 hours later. In meandtime i was wondering what the hell is going on. Well so I payed with credit card but had to wait for about 20 minutes for them to confirm transaction before i was able to download game. I almost thought site being fraud but they delivered in the end.

Purchased a game through DLGamer and wanted to change card details as I had not been charged and wished to use a different credit card. I was not contacted by DLGamer at any stage even after I made 4 support requests. Instead of requiring a code via SMS, the order was instead processed without permission or verification anyway. Very very shady and dishonest company. I do not trust this shady reseller and will never purchase from them again. ALWAYS TRUST AND USE STEAM OR GOG.COM. Took my money without verification (what the hell is the point of requiring phone code verification when you just take people's money regardless?) The hell with this company...

I tried purchasing a game at a deep sale rate. The experience was atrocious. Support was helpful in that they told me to just do the purchase again after it was canceled because I couldn't validate my phone number. I couldn't do that because the site glitched and never prompted me to enter that information.On another attempt, it straight up crashed while purchasing. Eventually, on this second purchase the item did go through. Support helped ensure I received my item in the end, but the transaction was not straight-forward nor clean.I think if they implemented a way to verify your account in the settings, so that you could verify it before purchasing, this would solve a lot of issues.

Made me sign in with an email address, get a confirmation number after purchase, then made me give a phone number after I had paid with paypal to then get a text with yet another number before giving me the key I paid for.

Review.Titre: Had to try four payment methods
Review.Contenu: Had to try four payment methods. Eventually PayPal worked, but only when funded by a bank account.Difficulty paying makes the operation feel pretty shady.Actual product was good once received: no complaints.

This site felt really sketchy, they would not accept my card, it was difficult to sign up and after paying with PayPal it took a long time to get my key.  Good sale price but the site overall is a mess.

Hello, sorry for the low score, but my experience has been frustrating. Why would you restrict the purchase of more than one of the same type of game for account/card, in this case an expansion to Guild Wars 2? I understand that it might be to stop others from taking advantage of something, but what about families? Why can't I simply buy two copies, one for me and one for my husband? I have one, but you won't take my credit card again or my debit since it has the same name, we've made a new account and still no, he's sent in a report so that someone can take a look and last I checked with him it hasn't been answered. Thanks for offering a game we were interested in at a great price, but if these are the rules, I'll have to pass on your site the next time, thank you again.

Review.Titre: Too much process to get a game
Review.Contenu: It was my first time to buy a game from dlgamer, and it took forever to validate my information, from confirming my email address, SMS text, and finally a phone call...
Great price, fast delivery...so why 2 stars?All the verification hoops. Several emails AND a phone call?! I am buying a game key not a car.
Good price, but I've made two purchases, and each time they've asked for my phone number to text/call me a confirmation code. Seems shady
They needlessly require personal information and say that it's for security reasons. It makes me question what they're doing with it.
Service was fine, but website was AWFUL. No online store should require both a personal computer *and* a cellular phone.
I had to provide way to much information to dlgamer in the name of 'security' to get my game. Lame.

Review.Titre: Return Policy Contradicts Itself and Phone Number Required... 2 Strikes
Review.Contenu: They had some pretty great deals but honestly was not a fan of the requirement of confirming email, AND a phone.. Never seen a company require a phone number as well. I'm sure they don't share the number or anything but ever since I purchased a game from their site, and gave them my phone number, I suddenly started having a scam claiming to be Verizon Wireless calling me. Also not a fan of their return policy as it's quite confusing. When I bought Monster Hunter Worlds, it stated on where It gave me the key that it has a no questions asked 14 day return policy if there's less than 2 hours played. But also says on their website's return policy if you redeem the key or download the game, you immediately give up your right for a return. Luckily, I liked the game so I didn't have to worry about this too much but.. Just be wary.Edit: lowered score. By a star. Between the many, many spelling errors when responding back to a bad review, and instantly sending another email saying “We permit ourselves to contact since there is a change[sic] for you to not receive our answer on your trustpilot comment.”Honestly shows me even more they aren’t very trustworthy since their support can’t even spellcheck before entitling themselves to sending an email.

Review.Titre: My order was cancelled for unclear…
Review.Contenu: My order was cancelled for unclear reasons. When I tried to contact support, I got no response.

Review.Titre: The user verification process is a mess …
Review.Contenu: The user verification process is a mess and requires way too much (personal) data.
Don't require phone verification or mention it before you charge money

Ordered a game on the 19th, received it 3 days later.  So, I decided to buy the NeuroVoider alpha, which only DLgamer seems to carry. I placed my order on the 19th January, 2016 and chose the bank transfer payment method. Then I transferred the money to the adress provided, which was so messily written I had doubts I sent it to the proper account.  At that point my order showing that all I needed to do to get the game was to transfer the money. I was thinking maybe the bank is waiting to do the actual transfer until the next day because I ordered sort of late in the day. Indeed, the transfer landed the next day, my bank told me. But no game code was seen on the website. I proceeded to contact their staff to clear this up. A day passed, no answer. The next day, I wrote again. No answer.  Infuriated, I started looking for alternative ways of contacting the staff of the site and found the support email adress and wrote there. I got a reply from them several hours later, in the middle of the night. They told me that I had not emailed them previously and that's when I realised the contact form on the website must have been broken.  After this, a lenghty exchange in broken English ensued. I was made to jump through seemingly infinite amount of hoops before the game code was actually released to me. I cannot recommend using their service to anyone at this point. If you are able, shop elsewhere.

Review.Titre: They hold your purchase hostage until…
Review.Contenu: They hold your purchase hostage until you give them your mobile number.

Review.Titre: Service is good bit when it comes to…
Review.Contenu: Service is good bit when it comes to refunds it becomes a problem

Review.Titre: Too many silly hoops to jump through
Review.Contenu: too many things to go through to get order "confirmed", including having to put in my sms... AFTER I already paid for my order. And then it took a long time to actually get the cd key I paid for and had to give away private info I didn't want to divulge - again, after it was already paid for! If you have the option, stay away from this seller. Edit:  There are at least two things dlgamer should do to increase customer experience, and I hope they'll consider them. - The possibility of phone verification should be stated clearly and explicitly BEFORE payment step, along with a link to longer explanation and privacy policy. Consider finding alternative ways to do this step.- They should inform clearly and explicitly that there can be an (up to 10 minute?) delay before the goods are delivered. Again, before payment step. These things should in no way come as a surprise to the customer after s/he has paid. In addition, storing that information opens up possible liability and trust problems for the store, as this is valuable data on the black market. And btw, that amazon does something doesn't necessarily convey credibility.  The rating stands. But if the site does update it's process to be more transparent and predictable further reviews might not be so negative. Edit2: They really .. they used my order name instead of my review name when answering. I am .. well, now I'm really worried they have my phone number. Edit3: And just noticed the amazon link is for 2step verification.. for your account. That is an optional extra security for logging into your account... Comparing that to mandatory phone number verification for seller's protection .. or other things... is showing a deep lack of understanding of the usage.
careful, they force you to phone verification

Review.Titre: Unnecessarily Long Process For One Purchase
Review.Contenu: Getting an account setup and getting a singular purchase made took infinitely more time than I felt that it should have. What should've been a two-step purchasing process turned into a ten-step flip between emails, other tabs, and this store and overall just ended up being a woefully long experience just to buy a single thing. I will be avoiding buying from here ever again if I can help it, just to avoid having to go through 5 levels of confirmation notices just to complete a singular order.Edit on 5/21/17: Apparently I cannot reply to store responses. Odd that the review site doesn't let me communicate with the store effectively. While the explanation of compliance with EU laws (which don't affect me personally as I am US based) is a valid reason for the additional security measures (owed to the EU's extensive consumer protection legislation), I still find that the entire process was overly arduous compared to competitors in your field. I have time-stamps from the emails I received from your company showing that the process of getting simply email-related confirmations out of the way took no less than 6 minutes; the total process, of course, took more time than that as I had to actually interact with your site after the several confirmations of confirmations had been processed through 3 emails and a text before I was allowed to *actually* proceed to checkout. The total time it took for my order to be completed by you from the time I clicked to checkout to the time that my key was accepted by Steam was at least a magnitude of 3 times or more than any other competitor of yours that I've done business with, even considering that this was a first-time, new account sale. If the standard checkout time is even half of what the first-time checkout process was, it would still be twice as fast to use any other storefront.I will not be changing my review score at this time because I honestly do believe that the over-verification hurt the user experience and ease of checkout when compared to other web-based key sellers. While I may give the store one additional chance in the future to see if things have been streamlined, I do not plan to willingly return to this storefront again unless some miraculous sale is taking place here. Coming here to purchase games currently on discount (when competitors are not) is simply not worth the red tape. I would rather spend the extra money elsewhere for the ease of use.

Got a working product from the site, but the activation process raised trust concerns. AFTER paying for the key I had to verify my address, my phone number, my Paypal email AND link my game store account to the site for activation without actually receiving any key. The game works, but I feel the procedure is tailored to fish as much information from you as possible. Avoid If you’re privacy sensitive.

It takes a while before you get the key, like 20 min.It also asks you for a lot of personal info before giving you the key (which is not indicated before purchasing) like adress and phone number.However the support chat is responsive and the key worked fine

Review.Titre: There were too many steps to checkout
Review.Contenu: There were too many steps to checkout, and i was a little uncomfortable being asked for my phone number. I don't think i needed one on a previous purchase.

Review.Titre: my game did not get delivered
Review.Contenu: my game did not get delivered and had to ask for a refund. the refund process is still going on right now. they are quick to respond though.

Review.Titre: Bought an OUT OF STOCK key
Review.Contenu: I bought a Steam key, couldn't find it anywhere and after contacting support I was told that they did not have stock and that the supplier will restock today.Asked for a refund which I got without problems.UPDATE: I was given £5 voucher a few days later for the trouble caused. Fair game :)

Review.Titre: The site is legitimate insofar as you…
Review.Contenu: The site is legitimate insofar as you receive the item you purchase. I would suggest removing mandatory phone verification however. If every other retail website can function without forcing consumers to disclose their mobile number, then so can Dlgamer. Consumers don't know who is, and who is not trustworthy; the more companies we provide a mobile number to, the higher the risk that someone is going to exploit it.

Review.Titre: No refund policy - Buy elsewhere if you think you might not like the game!
Review.Contenu: Game not as described on their website, no refund offered. Save your self the pain and buy off of a DLC platform like Steam or Epic which give you a 2 hour change of mind refund. Not worth the $10 savings imo.*Edit*: I agree with the response! Though, every DRM (i.e. steam, epic games, gog, origin etc) have a 2 hour refund policy. I suggest DLGamer update their policy to match the competition. The transaction process of the website went without a hitch though so 1* is a bit too harsh. 3* all around and would happily upgrade to a 5* if it wasn't for a terrible refund policy.

Review.Titre: Bought Guild Wars 2 HoT + PoF combo…
Review.Contenu: Bought Guild Wars 2 HoT + PoF combo pack for my girlfriend and a separate PoF key for myself in the same order. Checkout was quick but I only received the combo pack keys.I created a support ticket but no response after 36 hours. After that I decided to email them. I received a response with the missing key after a few hours but just that, no apology or explanation about what happened in the first place.

Review.Titre: Waiting for your purchase - worth the savings?
Review.Contenu: The site works and is seemingly "legitimate".  They sell digital copies of games, and you have to wait after purchasing a game for the staff to "review" your purchase before you are able to use it. In the bigger picture this is not a huge amount of time, but if you want to gift the game to someone or if you want to play it soon this extra waiting time can be excruciating. Any amount of money you save on purchases with DLgamer comes at this price.

The price was good, but the entire paying system is unintuitive and long. They ask for all the different passwords, codes and confirmations multiple times, and it takes forever to finally get a game here.And I had to get a refund and buy a game again, caus I didn't get the code the first time. Thank you for Far Cry 4, it's a fun game and your price was nice, but I'm done with you guys. Improve.

Review.Titre: Steam key trouble but good customer support
Review.Contenu: There was an issue of receiving a region-locked Steam key and the following replacement keys were also region-locked. Eventually, support cancelled the transaction, refunded me, and asked me to make a new purchase to get the proper Steam key. I was frustrated with the situation but greatly appreciated DLGamer support responding quickly to my support ticket and emails. The quick response and diligence from the support staff made this almost a 4 star experience.

The price was more than good enough to go through all of the extra security checks, and i do believe there should be too many as opposed to not enough. But the purchase process did feel slow, having to verify by both email and phone call. The phone-message could have been delivered via text as an option because my purchase had to be made in the afternoon due to not wanting the ringing phone to wake up my S.O. Food for thought.

Review.Titre: Good service for me, but not for my friend
Review.Contenu: I bought a game twice on two separate occasions using PayPal and had good experiences both times. My friend bought the same game about a week or two later using a credit card ran into some problems (was charged but did not receive the game). Pretty difficult to say for sure what I think of them based on these experiences, but my own purchases were quick and without any issues.

I bought a usually $60 game at DLGamer for $25. Great deal, but before I could get my key I went through layers and layers of identity verification, first email (pretty standard), then phone #(what?), neither of which worked correctly and I had to contact support both times. The process felt alarmingly phishey. In the end however I did get a working game key at a great price, so I might buy from DLGamer again in the future.

Review.Titre: Needs better checkout for US customers
Review.Contenu: The checkout process was pretty rough with a US credit card. You pay using a foreign bank for processing, have to give them your cell phone # for a security code text, and wait for transaction to go through. My credit card got flagged for unusual activity due to this transaction so I had to call my issuer to get that resolved.  Besides that, I received my Steam key just fine and was happy with the price.

I don't know why but I found my purchase with DLGamer to be frustrating.  It appears that one paids DLGamer and then downloads from Stream but that was not clear.  If I remember, I had to select the game on Stream, pay on DLGamer and then go back to Stream to download - certainly not a "normal" way to buy and download anything.

I don't mind some security when making an online purchase. But really? I even have to do SMS verification? I don't have a cell phone, had to use the wife's.  What if no cell had been available?  There are reasonable security precautions, then there is DLGamer's Orwellian overkill.  Otherwise, I had no problems with my purchase, and once I got through the maze of continual security walls, I received my activation code very promptly.

Review.Titre: Once you choose a payment metod you can't come back
Review.Contenu: The good,  Very fast comfirming the payment and delivering the key The bad,  Once you choose a payment metod you can't come back Also the price of the game on the store was diferent than the price on the check out. Had to buy it on the spanish website to be shure about how much i was paying. Good service but this kind of mistakes don't increase my trust in the system.

After payment was processed, requested a mobile number to send a code for authentication. I'm all for added security, but I paid with PayPal already, so this just smells of data gathering for sale to cold calling telemarketers/phishersmen. Springing it on me after payment felt like blackmail. Product key received and working, still feel a bit violated.

Review.Titre: They advertized Destiny 2 with pre-order bonus
Review.Contenu: They advertized Destiny 2 with pre-order Bonus, but after purchase and activated the game it didnt container the bonus code, Made contact with them and they offered 4 euro's back, but eventually they couldnt refund itEdited:After this review they contacted me and made a refund possible after all, after i gave them all my details for the refund i got a message they made a refund of 20 instead of 4 euros.Changed from 1/5 stars to 3/5 because they did fix the issue after this review

Actually is a legit site, despite looking shady as high hell.Somewhat frustrating to use, especially those wait times but you get what you pay for.I'm not sure how to reply to Dlgamer's comment, but I'll touch on it here.What put me off was how the site felt. It looked like one of those sites that were not legit. Big neon signs for the price buttons. Broken english and the like.I had to read some reviews about the site before being comfortable making a purchase.

Review.Titre: Decent service with atrocious download speeds.
Review.Contenu: Two issues: No PayPal option for new accounts, and DLGamer's file downloader is the slowest I've ever used -- it took over fourteen hours to download a 6GB package, but that could have something to do with the fact that DLG seems to be located in France while I'm in the US. Other than that, the experience was pretty standard for a digital retail service.

Review.Titre: Not much time spent on the website
Review.Contenu: I only purchased a game from this site since enhanced steam suggested that i do, so i made an account, bought the game and got the code in less than 5 minutes. The site seemed a little sketchy, but that's to be expected from stores that people are new to. If i had to i'd buy another game from this website again.

Review.Titre: Good prices, solid experience, be prepared to jump through hoops
Review.Contenu: Found a great deal on DLGamer for Civ V Complete, but I had to jump through a lot of hoops to get it.  I think there were three different points of verification I had to undergo to complete an order.  It was a lot.  I had to give them my phone number so they could call me with an automated message with one of my verification codes on top of the usual verification of email and verifying a text message.  It didn't totally put me off of the process, but like I said, it was a lot.

Review.Titre: Good overall experience, but the payment process needs some work
Review.Contenu: The deal I got was great, but it's not normal to take 15-20 minutes + interaction from my side (phone number, multiple confirmation emails) to complete the verification. The era when credit cards were stolen is pretty much over and for the majority of websites the payment verification and the delivery of the key is immediate, so it would be great if you could optimize that! Another thing - but I'm not sure of this - is that I think there is a (small) fee for using Visa cards.

Review.Titre: Downloading trouble but probably on rockstars end. Also my bank account was shut down from the purchase
Review.Contenu: I had downloading trouble . Had to download 3 times to get game to work. Although you just provided keys so probably on rockstsrs end. Main concern was that purchase from dlgamer shut down my bank account. The transaction drew up a flag with the company. Is back up now but you might want to look into that

Received the key very fast and it works perfectly. I paid with iDeal (through a Dutch bank) and I received some weird emails telling me I paid with HiPay (never heard of it) and that I'd made an account there... Which I'm pretty sure I didn't. That seemed kind of sketchy, but otherwise it's fine!

It was OK. It doesnt have much rep, nor does it look very professional in certain tabs. The only way i knew i could trust it was the GW2 website. Maybe do some advertising? Get a good rep from ads ?  Otherwise it was quite simple and It was a life saver when it comes to buying my birthday present.

Okay so I bought something and tried to use my visa debit card, but was put through a (annoying) verification process that ended up in my card being declined. I gave up and tried to pay with paypal(the same debit card is linked to my paypal). PayPal payment worked fine and I was able to get the code I bought after like 10 minutes. The verification process seemed weird and sketchy, I have never experienced anything like that when purchasing online. But so far nothing unusual has happened to my bank account, so that's good.

Requesting my address, phone number, and requiring a three-stage confirmation after I paid and before you delivered my order looks like a complete scam. I don't care you eventually delivered the Steam key, other sellers do not need ANY of that information provided.EDIT: Fair enough, I appreciate you following regulations and replying with detailed information, but I still don't buy how email+phone confirmation codes made the transaction any "safer", and the process was still significantly more complicated than with other sellers.

Purchasing from the site was fine, activating my product was not. It took several activation methods and a lot of unnecessary personal details for me to actually get my product. I'd recommend for the prices they have, but if you're looking for a quick purchase process then look elsewhere.

There is way too many different confirmations you need to make. Email, SMS, codes. Too much things to do for a simple action as buying a game.Still, I got the game, it works, you just need to be patient to buy from this store. If you gonna buy multiple items, it might get annoying.

Review.Titre: Rocky start, made right in the end.
Review.Contenu: After a semi lengthy back and forth with support about being given the wrong edition of a game I had ordered and redeemed (I received a standard edition of ESO Morrowind Upgrade, not the collectors edition upgrade I payed for), I was given a third key to redeem that unlocked the correct collectors edition upgrade, rather then the standard edition my original key had unlocked. They aren't sure themselves how I was sent the wrong key, but at least support was quick to begin a dialog, and eventually figure out what I was saying and correct the mistake.

Review.Titre: got the game, took abit of time.
Review.Contenu: Got the game which is alway a great plus, however it took a bit of time with strange authentication methods, which I've never experienced with other companies. And slightly regret the purchase and wish I did more research as found the game for significantly cheaper on numerous websites.

Review.Titre: Got a good deal but not without some hassle.
Review.Contenu: Purchased a steam key on DLGAMER and instead of just putting in my payment information and receiving a key I was forced to do not only email but phone verification as well. Would prefer a smoother experience although I suppose it was worth it for a fe bucks off of my game.

During the purchase process they were quick to take my money but took around 10 minutes to give me my key. The key did work though so all is well in the end. Also funny passive aggressive customer support (in reference to the reply to this) - as someone that works in a similar environment they're trained well. :)- In regards to the rating they suggested I update: I still feel as though this is merely Average service as per TrustPilot ratings it was acceptable although I never felt anything to compel me back to your website even well over a year later.

The purchase process was scary, it seemed scamish, my credit card company thought so too, as it alerted to a scam.  However, it did go through for the correct amount and the key worked on steam.  I'm glad it worked, but a more trusted eCommerce middleman would be welcomed.

Prices are pretty good, but the process is excruciatingly frustrating.Edit: I received a reply/explanation from DLGamer; PayPal was my second attempt at paying for my purchase, as my Chase Visa flagged the transaction as suspicious. I had to switch to a secondary billing method. After, I had to verify the transaction via text, which did not fire correctly on the first attempt. In total, it took 16 minutes for a process that at several points I should have probably walked away. The price for the product is the only reason I don't rate the transaction two stars.

I bought a game for a friend who bought it for themselves before I could give them an activation key. I contacted customer support and assured them that the key was not used. A week later and the key was not removed from my account and nobody else from DLGamer's customer service contacted me to let me know what was going on. Ordering the product also involved me going to three different web sites to verify my identity and credit card. I appreciate the security, but the hoops I've had to jump through so far mean I'm probably not going to use it again.

The game I purchased was well priced, but DLGamer's key delivery system seems to have problems.A key showed up after I purchased my game as expected, but it didn't work.  The provided key changed several times before I received a working one.

Generally fine experience so far. Although I found it a little strange when I created my account that they emailed me a password rather than me creating my own. I wasn't prompted to change it on first log in, and had to hunt for the change password option.

Review.Titre: I recieved an invalid code on my first…
Review.Contenu: I recieved an invalid code on my first purchase, but customer service was helpful and friendly and gave me a refund immediately, so i will continue to do buissness with them. I expected better verification of products, but the staff handled the issue well.

Review.Titre: I completely forgot that G2A was a thing or I'd have used them.
Review.Contenu: I can appreciate the serious nature of the Paypal verification I was forced to undergo but at times it felt like I was being phished somehow. I needed to give phone numbers and a home address as well as enter email codes and receive an automated phone call. Although I am happy with the transaction, I realized shortly after I could've bought the same game for over USD$10 less at a competing online retailer. I've looked for a price match policy disclosure on DLGAMER's website but I cannot find one. Needless to say, I probably won't be using this website again.

Needed to enter a lot of personal information, and STILL needed to provide a phone number AFTER already giving payment. Further, the phone verification step failed for me, and now I'm currently stuck in limbo without the game code nor an option to refund/cancel my order. I used their online support form for help, but have not received any response.The few bucks saved is not worth going through this hassle.EDIT: Support contacted me after posting this review, and I was able to get the game code. They also offered a partial refund for these technical issues, but I have not verified this yet.

Review.Titre: Good, but some confusion on price, and payment checking
Review.Contenu: Everthing about the experience was pretty easy. My first concern was that I applied a 25% discount code to an order of $25, and it went to $22.50. I didn't realise that the 25% wouldn't stack with the existing $5 discount, and neither did the site that linked the deal to me. It was still the best price around, but quite disappointing when I'd expected a better deal. Second, it felt like it took a bit to long to get through several stages of authentication, and even then I had to wait a while for my steam code to appear. Other sites are much smoother in this regard.

I have now purchased several items from this shop, usually for a better price than its competitors. While all of these transactions were successful, the checkout experience is cumbersome, requiring validation and even a phone call for every single purchase.

The deals are often better than Steam once you can wrestle a game from the system, and it does seem legitimate, but the process is an ordeal.Each purchase requires several layers of authentication, which while it may sound nice can take over half an hour per purchase. First you place your order, then wait for it to be authenticated by their team, which can take quite a while, as it doesn't appear to be automatic. Then an email is sent to your paypal account email to confirm purchase. Then they phone you with another code to enter. Then the order must be "prepared", before you finally get your game.

Review.Titre: Forces you to make an account including…
Review.Contenu: Forces you to make an account including phone, address etc to make a purchase, which seems dodgy - I'd have prefered to purchase with a guest account and not giving personal info, but the purchase went through ok.

Convoluted first purchaseMaking my first purchase was a little more involved than with other sites. I have accounts on six other game stores and this is the first one where I had to enter a code sent via e-mail along with a code sent via SMS to my personal mobile phone number. It's only been a few days since my purchase but I don't see the phone listed anywhere in my account settings. I hope this was a one-time deal. They don't make it clear why my mobile number was necessary. Even browsing through the FAQs afterwards, I couldn't find a reason for this.Otherwise, my experience with the site itself was positive overall and I received my working Steam key almost immediately.

Review.Titre: A bit over the top on security
Review.Contenu: The storefront is fine, but the checkout process was quite tedious for a $30 transaction.  Basically had to go through 3 or 4 security checks.  I think two were via e-mail, one was by phone, etc.I can understand if someone was buying multiple games or keys that it would be prudent to have that security check, but for a first-time purchase and for something so trivial (its a video game) it seemed like overkill.Other than that, everything else seemed ok.  Price was good which was what motivated the transaction, but if it wasn't for price, there wouldn't have been much incentive to jump through all those hoops.

Buying things is pretty invasive... requiring phone numbers and phone calls. Otherwise the process was fine. Got what I expected. Probably wouldn't purchase again... simply because of the invasive purchase requirements.

before I bought total war: warhammer II from you, I am pretty sure it said it can active at m country, but when i got the serial, steam just said the key can't active at taiwan.at least i can return the key  :<

After taking a customer's money, any verification system needs to be 100% bullet proof. DLGamer's is not. It hangs up on me, and I am having to wait on their customer service, which can only be reached via e-mail, and has not replied after a reasonably short wait for a quick e-mail response (also, no immediate reply via Twitter). I have done nothing wrong and have not been delivered my product for my payment. EDIT: DLGamer reached me back within a couple of hours and, after fulfilling the order, continued on to refund my purchase price for the game as an apology for the failed automatic verification. This was a noble thing for them to do.

The best thing I can say about this company is that they offer great deals.  The only hang up I have is the way they do purchases.  I'm not a fan of having to put my phone number in and get a automated phone call with a code before the purchase is complete.  It's clunky and lacks that sense of professionalism you get with other retailers.  On top of that I made a purchase heading towards a week ago and it still hasn't been posted to my credit card yet. If they can smooth out their setup a bit I'd easily give them 4-5 stars.  However as it is now they would have to be offering a pretty substantial deal before I'd want to use them again.

A really good price for the games — but with some difficulties. The website often looses the cookies forsing you to re-login on every page. Also, it didn't accept my credit card, so I had to use Paypal (no problem here, though).

Review.Titre: still waiting for the text message
Review.Contenu: Had to wait for more than 30 minutes for a text message on the phone with a code to confirm the purchase. The text never arrived and after a few minutes the purchase automatically changed to successful and recived my game code.

Process with having to write code from email and then enter phone number and write code from SMS is not only weird for logged in user with previous orders. But primarily it's NOT described before money are sent.

The site has good deals and seems to be reputable from the research I did. However, the design of the site makes it feel sketchy and made me want to check other internet information before making a purchase.

Key worked, no issues, although I have to say their site and the site they redirect you to to pay look totally sketchy. But it worked fine, and no one has stolen my identity or anything, so I guess they're ok.
I am not sure if they are trustworthy, I have not seen my bank statement yet and it’s only been a couple days since my purchase . The game did get transferred as described with a working CD key.

Review.Titre: Decent price, weird site layout and purchase setup
Review.Contenu: The purchase was easy enough, but the process of getting my key was a little convoluted, could have been easier and more seamless. I don't need to see all the steps. Take my money and give me the Steam key.

DLGamer is the discount steam dealer, you get to pay a fraction of the price and endure a short wait before you get your steam key, at night at least. All-in-all worth being a go to daytime discount game dealer.

I'm giving you 3 stars because while I value my security, the amount of hoop jumping, code verifications, etc. I had to go through to complete my purchase made me never want to use your service again.

While the purchase went well, and I appreciate the acceptance with Paypal, the security measure with a phone was kind of annoying. Didn't like it too much, but acceptable. The deal was also very good.

Review.Titre: Asks for way too much information
Review.Contenu: Even when using paypal, for a digital download where they should require NO info for shipping, they still ask for address and phone number (required) AND they do an actual robo phone call to verify it's you.  The only thing I can guess is that they must be selling your info to make up the cost of the discounts they give.  Why else would they need 3 times the verification of any other online store I've ever shopped at, for a download code of all things? Edit: I notice in your reply you do not actually say, "No we do not sell your information, it is ONLY used for verification."  Was that an oversight?  How do all of the other game code selling sites manage to not ask for this information and still turn a profit?
Yeah I got a cheap game, but the authentication was some Digital River-levels of idiotic. Took way longer to get my code than I would've liked. So many websites are way simpler to use, why bother?
I ordered a steam key from DLGamer. The process took a bit of cajoling because Paypal invalidated my email. So, my order was cancelled, then I re-ordered. After that, it was generally smooth sailing.

Review.Titre: More time consuming than most game download sites.
Review.Contenu: I base where I download games from based on prices from isthereanydeal.com. Out of Steam, GamersGate, Amazon, GetGames, Desura, GOG, Nuuvem, IndieGala, GameFly, Origin, Humble Store, and IndieGameStand that I have purchased from, DLGamer has given me the worse purchasing experience to day. To be fair, their FAQ does mention that the first purchase may take from under ten minutes up to 24 hours, with subsequent purchases falling in the under 10 minute range (I bought a second game that this was true with).  It would be my recommendation for them to take $50 of "research" money and buy some games from these other sites so they know how much easier the experience is at the competition. This might let them improve their process.

Review.Titre: You have to work for it.
Review.Contenu: The checkout process is absolutely ridiculous for a first time customer - email verification, phone verification, on top of an already verified PayPal account to name a few. The whole thing is not fast and definitely not easy.It was so much it seriously made me wonder whether or not the site was legit, but I got the steam key.Edit in reply:First, the total checkout process took longer than 78 seconds, but that hardly matters. The point is that the number of steps required was onerous. As a developer myself, I’m sensitive to the balance between security and usability; however, you all should also be happy to use this to improve your service. I’m not trying to review bomb anyone - and a 3/5 is hardly bad, but you should know (which I imagine is why you solicit feedback).

Review.Titre: Way too much faffing around and red …
Review.Contenu: Way too much faffing around and red tape. Other sites I just click click click done. This one took like three steps of approval. Sure that's secure but it's pretty inconvenient.

Firstly I will start by saying I would use them again... however I am not sure I would want to make a new account with them again or recommend them to a friend due to their super-long winded process. To buy a game:1) Create a PayPal account2) Verify PayPal account with PayPal3) Select Game with DLGamer and proceed to checkout4) Create a DLGamer account, full delivery information, even for a CD-Key!5) Verify your email address6) Complete transaction through PayPal7) Get email to redeem your code8) Verify your mobile number (again, even after PayPal requires this for a verified account) with DLGamer9) Enjoy your purchase. Not even Amazon requires a verified mobile phone, not sure why these guys do! Please simplify the process, I almost gave up with the transaction.

Review.Titre: Seems like the site is gathering more…
Review.Contenu: Seems like the site is gathering more info about people than it should. Maybe they sell it, maybe they don't but it doesn't feel good to give it just to buy a game key.
I appreciate the steps taken to ensure credit card/order verification, but a text would have been preferred to a call. However, I don't think either is required.

After taking my money, this company refused to provide the product until I jumped through a few hoops with email and text verification that I wasn't made aware of prior to handing over my money.  I suppose I can expect some spam texts and calls from the people this company have sold my details to.  Please note that the previous responses from DLGAMER on this point aren't true: I was forced to go through these steps even though the address on my PayPal account was the same as on DLGAMER so that excuse is a fabrication.  If you go with this company, you'll have to deal with the inconvenience regardless of the address.  I wish I had gone through Steam or another key site (I've never had this hassle with the ones I've used before) because it was a tiny saving and I feel as though I've been taken for a ride.
I got a great price on the game I wanted, but had to verify my identity/payment information 3 different times. Kind of a hassle, but I was willing to save the coin.
A bit of a odd shop.not really sure about it.it is legit and send me the game i bought directly.but the order emails i received about my payment were a bit odd.

Review.Titre: Too much hassle and checks they don't warn you about
Review.Contenu: I wanted to buy a game. So I added it to my cart, paid for it via paypal. Now they have my money, but they want my phone number before releasing the code!!  They have my money. I have no game. What kind of a way to run a business is that? If they want all kinds of extra information, they should ask for it BEFORE you pay, so you have a chance to go elsewhere.What's next? After they have my phone number, they want my passport too? Avoid this site. They don't tell you about all their "security" checks, which smells like another way of harvesting information to sell to ad networks.I have requested they release the code or refund my money. I will adjust this score once they have provided good customer service.-------------------------------------------------Edit: They refunded the money. Bump to 3 stars from 1, for at least being prompt.

Review.Titre: The shopping experience was slow and …
Review.Contenu: The shopping experience was slow and consisted of many steps. Checkout processes in, for example, Steam and Amazon, are more streamlined and way faster.
It's somewhat convulted to receive 2 verifications codes to buy an item with paypal. and it forces me to give my phone number which I don't like
I got my game, but had to go through a lot of hoops to get it. If it wasn't for the good price of the game I would have just gotten it through steam.
Good price. But had to play 20 questions with email and text messages before I was added to access my game, after it had already charged my account.

Review.Titre: Took a bit longer than expected
Review.Contenu: But they delivered in the end. I didn't get their weird confirmation SMS to my phone, but I managed to get the code anyways after e-mailing them.

Review.Titre: Not allowing me to buy multiple copies…
Review.Contenu: Not allowing me to buy multiple copies of a game while the company (Arenanet) has no issue with people having multiple accounts.
Key delivered quickly and adequately, but for whatever reason purchasing from this site locked my debit card and I had to get a new one.
Good prices. Bad user confirmation , it requires sms confirmation for codes or landline calls. NEITHER OF WHICH WORKS. Waste of my time
Was unaware that they were international so was charged extra fee for that,  but great service and product delivered right away

Review.Titre: Worked fine but they keep bugging you
Review.Contenu: Worked fine and got my stuff but when you buy something then they keep sending serperate mails begging for trustpilot reviews.

Review.Titre: Got the game, the verification was a pain though.
Review.Contenu: The sale worked, the key worked, I just don't really get why they need to do a phone number verification.
I bought a couple keys, had an issue, was fixed, they are sold out so i couldnt get my wife the game, etc.

Review.Titre: It wasn't as streamlined as what I am use to. Great price though.
Review.Contenu: I am more use to USA system. Your system wasn't as user friendly. I did appreciate paying with paypal.

Review.Titre: Stop sending me emails asking for a review.
Review.Contenu: Seriously. Your website is perfectly ordinary and emailing me for stupid reasons makes me like you less.
Maybe it is only at the first purchase, but phone verification, etc. felt too much to buy a video game.

Review.Titre: way too much personal info needed to …
Review.Contenu: way too much personal info needed to buy a key.  take my account info and money, thats all you need.
Got locked out of account and couldn't activate game, but got a quick response from support team
I wish the transaction could be faster and without me needing to share my phone number.
Nice over all, not a fan of giving out my Phone # in order to use my credit card tho.

Review.Titre: Order verification was sketchy and took twenty minutes, but the deal was worth it

Review.Contenu: I'm still confused how to download dlc because there is no link available.

Review.Titre: Both the game for a 3party is doing vr …
Review.Contenu: Both the game for a 3party is doing vr suport but dont work for me yet.

Review.Titre: the verification process took too long …
Review.Contenu: the verification process took too long in comparison to other sites.

Review.Titre: Nice! Been waiting for the chance after 2 years to play this game 😁
Review.Contenu: Nice. Quickturn after paid. Too bad I was buying the game before Halloween, few days after steam also give discount that is cheaper than this site. Anyway, DLGamer has great price for digital games purchase also proven as a valid steam key 👍

Fast delivery, Registrable key.But it's sorry that customer service is little disappointing.Since the game was able to be bought only one copy per a person, I asked if I could buy 5 more copies of the game.In an hour, they replied and said just buy like that. but it was not possible because checkout system did not allow it.Eventually, I couldn't buy games as I want.

Review.Titre: I was initially suspicious but now happy
Review.Contenu: I was initially suspicious by the level of information required for a simple steam code transaction, but I received the ordered keys promptly and they were as ordered.   While a high level of security was required (needing a code sent by text) this has in hindsight reassured me of the site's legitimacy.

Review.Titre: Could of made it a bit easier then it…
Review.Contenu: Could of made it a bit easier then it was but overall good service.

Review.Titre: There was an Issue with my order
Review.Contenu: There was an Issue with my order, however they responded really quickly and solved my problem with profesionality, definitely would recommend
Very very Good price !! but more than 6 hours before having the key :(

Review.Titre: A little zealous in confirmation of…
Review.Contenu: A little zealous in confirmation of ones identity but I assume and hope this just to better protect them from charge backs, which fine as long as their storage of personal information is well locked down.Turn around time of transaction was almost instant for digital goods once all the verification steps were completed.Happy to complete further purchases in the future at this stage.

Review.Titre: Ordering game key was easy enough from…
Review.Contenu: Ordering game key was easy enough from here, item arrived by email quickly.Was 50% off in Euro region stores but only 5% for UK!!! , which seems wrong in my view , ordered through French region version for better price. Would use again if place is on games official key seller list.For an improvement I would like to see all region sale percentages be equal in future.

Your website seems odd to operate. Purchasing the game felt awkward, to the point that I had to go to reddit to verify if your website was legit. I got the game and everything was fine, I'd just recommend updating your "shopping cart" and your purchasing process so its more clear what the user is doing when.Edit: I was using a PC. Uping to 4 stars because of the quick reply.

Great deals and great customer service. The biggest flaw is the annoying verifications when buying a game, which I guess isn't that bad when the system is working as it is supposed to. In my case, the system didn't work properly and this process became rather time-consuming, but they took the time and explained what happened.

The page said that I can activate the game in my country but I couldn't buy it. The message said the price would be 2 EUR higher but there was no link to that price/page. Even with that price the game worth it so I am confused and a bit disappointed I had to cheat with VPN to buy it.

Review.Titre: Good, but a little too much trouble.
Review.Contenu: I had to do too much work just to get my key. Also, they asked too much personal information and made me give them my phone number etc.. they are still good and reputable company though. I rate them as 8/10 on a scale of 1 to 10 and I would buy from them again if the price is low like it was for my copy of resident evil 3.

Review.Titre: Takes my money and refuses contact
Review.Contenu: Edit:After leaving negative review I got contacted immediately and my issue was resolved. That is good. What's not good is I had to go through all of this to finalise the purchase. Original:I purchased a key two weeks ago and still didn't recieve it. Any forms of contact with the seller go unanswered. I tried contacting them via contact form on the site - no answer. I sent a direct email - no answer. My money is gone and I didn't recieve a key

Review.Titre: Purchase was charged to my credit card…
Review.Contenu: Purchase was charged to my credit card without any issues and I received my code within five minutes. Both the main site and their secure payment site look a little shady, but I believe that's because they're both outside The United States (France, maybe?) and the translations are a little off and the logos are unfamiliar. Would be willing to buy again and give a full 5 stars if no issues encountered on second purchase.

Review.Titre: I had the idea that the Steam keys…
Review.Contenu: I had the idea that the Steam keys would be sent soon after purchase. Received it several days later, was told that for preorders, keys are released based on the publisher's decision. Overall purchase experience was ok, discounted price was great! Response time from the team was good, would be perfect if English was better, had difficulty making out what they were trying to express.

Review.Titre: Was looking for Max Payne 3 on sale
Review.Contenu: Was looking for Max Payne 3 on sale, they had it at the lowest price, sent me the code within minutes an it totally worked- although when I was sent the code it said it was for steam, I actually had to enter in Rockstar's launcher. But I get to play all the same, I'd say as trustworthy as cdkeys.

Buying on DLGAMER was a good experience, only thing that was a negative was that game I was looking for (marked as available in my country) wasn't purchase-able for my country, this was contradicting so I contacted the support team and they fixed the issue in timely manner.

Review.Titre: Good website. I got my key pretty quicly and service was good despite the site looking pretty shady
Review.Contenu: I first thought this site was shady AF but I had no problems. The service was pretty good and I got my key pretty much instantly. The only problem was that the dutch translation of the game description on the website was pretty bad. Also, some of the payment pages were in German, for me that's not a problem (I'm not super bad at german) but it might be for some other customers. Pretty good but could be better.

Review.Titre: Was Skeptical At First. Turned Out To Be A Great Experience.
Review.Contenu: I was a bit skeptical when I first read about DLGamer on some forums. I had usually stuck to Steam and GOG however as time went by I found my experience with this site was far more customer friendly than others. Everything was prompt, delivered on time and I never had 'duplicate key' issues or anything of the sort as I did on other retailers. Thanks DLGamer. Your discounts are excellent at times though I do miss the 5% VIP discount. :(

This was my first time purchasing from this company.  There were quite a few hoops to go through to get the security of the site so I could purchase the game, so be prepared for emails and questions as you go through the process.All of that said, I do appreciate the extra security. I was able to get my game my Steam key and installed it.

A few extra steps to complete the purchase compared to other digital distributors (not necessarily a bad thing). Otherwise simple process and got my keys in just a couple minutes. My only complaint is that I was unable to use a Discover credit card, other distributors have more options when it comes to making a purchase.

I bought monster hunter with PayPal, awesome. I then tried buying Nier with the same account, declined, tried again, declined. Hmm. One last time, same account, same PayPal, declined and now my account is blocked.Awesome.Edit:They reached out and took care of this for me

Review.Titre: I feel confident that they're reputable …
Review.Contenu: I feel confident that they're reputable and reliable. I only rated below 5 stars because this is my first experience buying from DLGamer and I have yet to form a real conclusion. However, the process was a breeze and PayPal makes it breezier. As of yet, I certainly have no reservations about this site.

I've only just heard of DLGamer recently so I decided to give them a try as one of my other online haunts for games purchasing really turned me off with the way they handled some stuff with me recently. Picked up the newest Titanfall but the key issued to me didn't work. With a quick back and forth with support, who were surprisingly expedient in returning my query, we had it resolved within 20 minutes and a new key issued. Thanks a bunch and looking forward to dealing with you guys in the future.

Review.Titre: So far my experience has been fair when …
Review.Contenu: So far my experience has been fair when I purchased a game and it didn't work even after countless hours tinkering I asked for a refund and there was no problem. That's is why I came back to purchase another game. Would be nice to have better exchange rates for Canadian but so far so good.

The keys arrived within 10 minutes, but for verification purpose a telephonenumber is required to get the keys. The need of verifiaction is sadly mentioned after the payment and not as you sign up the account...Support answers quickly, but mind their timezone as the support works in European time.

Review.Titre: Invalid key - Replaced by support in less than five minutes
Review.Contenu: I purchased Dishonored for steam, but the steam key I received to redeem was invalid and did not work. The website made it easy to contact support, and they resolved my problem within five minutes of me contacting them, making me leave this (relatively) good review, as opposed to a bad one.

Review.Titre: Problem at first but sorted out very quickly.
Review.Contenu: The price was great, cheaper than buying direct. The ordering process was quick and efficient. However there was a problem with the first serial I was sent, but after an email to support I was very quickly provided another that worked fine. Overall I'm happy with the experience.

Review.Titre: Got me my key quickly BUT they want all of your info
Review.Contenu: They take your money and require you to give them your number so they can call/text you a code used to get your game key. Also wanted address so they can sell it online but you can just put a phony one.EDIT: I have to give DLgamer credit, they either have a really good bot monitoring these pages or a good staff who explained to me the reasoning behind the hoops required to jump through for them to give us good deals, Please see the reply to my review my DLGamer and ignore my previous review which I'm leaving just for context.Edit 2: Test

Relatively quick and easy transaction. However, I wish there was an option for the steam version of a game where games are on multiple platforms/standalone. Asked for a lot of info and to verify my phone number which was odd. I guess to prevent fraud which is understandable.

Review.Titre: The first question on most people's…
Review.Contenu: The first question on most people's mind about dlgamer.com is, whether or not it is legit.Enough people from 3rd party sites have said it, so that's why I bought something from you. But if you could do more to prove that you really are legit, it can only help.

Alien : Isolation - The CollectionTime: Less than 5 minutesOnly a negative point the keys are stored there on the side possible possibility of doubled n / a but otherwise very good fast gings also am satisfied for 12 euro ^^ the The Collection Edition game was well rated :)

While secure, they required several extra steps of confirmation (e-mail code AND texted security code) before I could download a game that I had already been charged for through PayPal. Got a great deal, but was a little concerned when I did not receive my code right away.

I purchased Guild Wars 2, and I wasn't expecting so much verification.  Just to get the order through, and paying using PayPal, I had to give a verification key from my PayPal email, and then a verification from my phone.  Neither of which went very smoothly, as my email is already 2-factor authentication, and same with PayPal.  I understand the security aspect, but at the same time, this was rougher than using Amazon.  There is a reason why companies like Amazon and Apple have humans to review orders, and why sometimes they're delayed for up to two hours.

Used once. It may be secure, but definitely invasive. I had to put my phone number in order to get a pin code to complete transaction. Funny story: created my account 3 minutes before. There was absolutely no way to confirm that the phone number used was actually mine.

This was the cheapest deal I could jump on for Battlefield 1. I appreciated the 2 security checks the site performed to ensure my identity as a valid customer and not a miscreant. I'm hopeful the measures they're taking here ensures my game codes continue to work!

I gave them my money, and I received a key for the game I paid for. Only reason it is not 5 stars is because I still can't get over how shady the site looks. All the dealings were fine but even after completing the deal I felt like I was swindled (but I wasn't!)

Review.Titre: Experience was great with a small…
Review.Contenu: Experience was great with a small caveat the purchase sent me to another site for download of actual game and an account required there. But the price was excellent and worth the trip to secondary site. But I suppose this is the nature of most online games for PC.

Review.Titre: Great Transaction, Lots of Personal Information Surrendered
Review.Contenu: The price and product were great and delivered in a timely fashion, but I did feel like I had to give my bank routing numbers and firstborn child (and the child's bank routing numbers) to make the purchase.

Review.Titre: The first look at the site, it does …
